qas.question: Which empires grew during the 18th century?
What were the economies of the European empires built on?
What country near China did the Europeans first control?
What was the only city the Chinese allowed the Europeans into to trade?
Which two European companies traded in Canton?

answers.text: British East India Company and the Dutch East India Company

context: However, the 18th century saw the European empires gradually expand across the world, as <a0_0>European states<a0_0/> developed economies built on <a1_0>maritime trade<a1_0/>. The dynasty was confronted with newly developing concepts of the international system and state to state relations. European trading posts expanded into territorial control in nearby <a2_0>India<a2_0/> and on the islands that are now Indonesia. The Qing response, successful for a time, was in 1756 to establish the <a3_0>Canton<a3_0/> System, which restricted maritime trade to that city and gave monopoly trading rights to private Chinese merchants. The <a4_0>British East India Company and the Dutch East India Company<a4_0/> had long before been granted similar monopoly rights by their governments.
